definition: generic term for hard writing instruments such as quill pens, fountain pens, ball pens and pencils, as opposed to writing brushes
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

sentences.english: Then she practiced English hard-tipped calligraphy for a while.
sentences.chinese: 接着她练习了一会儿英语硬笔书法。

sentences.english: Streaks of hair fined out using smudge tool and small hard brushes.
sentences.chinese: 用模糊工具和小的硬笔刷来刻画头发的纹理。

sentences.english: My daughter practiced hard-tipped calligraphy this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上，我女儿练习了硬笔书法。

sentences.english: Also I turned calligraphy and paintings, music is very good at.
sentences.chinese: 另外本人硬笔书法以及美术，音乐方面很擅长。

sentences.english: My daughter practiced English and Chinese hard-tipped calligraphy this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上，我女儿练习了中英文硬笔书法。

sentences.english: T have to scratch your head hard.
Next, use a large, hard-edged white brush to remove any remaining background grey.
sentences.chinese: 下面，用一个大的硬笔刷移除背景上剩余的灰色。

sentences.english: When we go back home, she does some handwriting exercises and then learns English.
sentences.chinese: 我们回家后，她又练了几版硬笔书法。

sentences.english: So I asked her to begin to practice hard-pen calligraphy today.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我让她从今天开始练习硬笔书法。

definition: to practice calligraphy from a model
piece of paper with short note/short letter
to copy (a model of calligraphy or painting)
